laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild hypercalcemia: 11.1 mg/dL at 2 years, 11.2 mg/dL at 6 years. Normal serum phosphate levels.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression from normal calcium levels to mild hypercalcemia in patient 1.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Undetectable or reduced PTH levels for patient 1; 6.0 pg/ml at 6 years for patient 1.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: PTH levels well below normal range over time for patient 1.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated total alkaline phosphatase activity: 701 IU/L at 2 years, 507 IU/L at 6 years for patient 1.
Normal serum calcium level: 9.0 mg/dL for patient 3.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressed to mild hypercalcemia (11.2 mg/dL) by 4 years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: PTH at the lower end of the normal range for patient 3.
Never overtly hypercalcemic for patient 2; at age 38, ionized calcium at upper end of normal (1.29 mmol/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Calcium at the lower end of the normal range at age 32.

laboratory_examinations.findings: PTH levels either slightly elevated or within normal range for patient 2.
Urinary calcium-to-creatinine ratio significantly increased for all patients; specific values not stated.
Elevated at 94.9 pg/ml for patient 2 at age 38.
